author: gcolvin
content: In general, we _have_ to be able to change gas prices.  The cost of executing opcodes changes as hardware advances, and as our clients advance.  And we learn -- sometimes by suffering DoS attacks -- that our gas prices are just wrong.  The clients whose code I know have mechanisms in place for dealing with this, so it shouldn't be a big deal.
